alert.note: Alert for NW Blount (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 3:10PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN BLOUNT COUNTY THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 410 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Maryville, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Maryville, Alcoa, Louisville, Greenback, Friendsville, and Clover Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
